summary: The Advancing Maternal Health Equity Under Medicaid Act aims to improve maternal healthcare access. It proposes a higher federal matching rate for states increasing Medicaid spending on maternal health services. The bill defines maternal health care services and sets accountability measures for states receiving additional funding, including requirements to supplement, not supplant, existing funding, and to use funds for activities that enhance the delivery of maternal health care services. Definitions for maternal care providers and perinatal health workers are also included.
